components.name: eucanetd
components.description: Used to track component level items associated with Edge.

fields.description:
VM console output during load tests are showing the instances are failing to get metadata service (and ssh keys) within the cloud-init timeout 
During my recent VPC stress tests, I've found that the system I've been testing on has seemed to degrade in it's results/performance over the course of the last 3-7 days. On day 1 I was able to run 125 concurrent instances across 25 accounts (5/account) w/o a problem. 4 days later I can only run about 10-15 Vms across 3 accounts w/o issue. When running a single VM at a time I'm able to get up to  75 VMs total and now it appears each vm I attempt after that is failing to get Metadata/ssh keys. 


Sample Console output from a failed VM. 
This line looks suspicious: "2015-09-12 18:52:01,633 - DataSourceEc2.py[CRITICAL]: giving up on md after 25211 seconds"
May also need to look into cloud-init for how it handles elapsed time/timeouts during an ntp update, etc..

fields.summary: VPC - VMs fail to get metadata during minor load

comments.body: likely has to do with timing of when metadata subsystem is ready versus when the VM is requesting metadata.  currently experimenting with retries in the subsystem (which will look like a delayed HTTP response to the client)

[~mclark], can you try to reproduce this case on the system again?  I've made an alteration to //usr/share/eucalyptus/nginx_proxy.conf on h-10.qa1 that I believe will mitigate/solve the issue, but I cannot current reproduce the condition on that system through normal means.

I've stored the original file in /root/nginx_proxy.conf.orig on h-10.qa1 in case we need to restore the default behavior (replace the file, killall nginx, and restart eucanetd in case we want to revert to original)

d

Thanks [~nurmi], 
I’ll kick off a few tests, and continue building the load until we either hit this issue, another, or run out of resources :-).  I'll update with the results. 

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/view/Matts/job/nephoria_stress_test/build?delay=0sec

Feel to run this job against this cloud or any other too if you’d like. 
This job is just a wrapper on the basic script originally used to produce this issue. Just plug in the CLC IP of the cloud you want to test against and edit the user + vm counts and press go. Disclaimer the test terminates the instances but leaves the accounts/users and likely other artifacts behind. 
Thanks, 
-M

Quick update:
Using the same cloud and  job: http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/view/Matts/job/nephoria_stress_test/
MD fails at roughly 11-12 accounts launching 2 VMs each (22-24 total VMs). This time the MD responses are primarily '111' connection refused (vs the 404s before). 

For comparison I was able to run the same test against the Edge scale system w/ 2 tests;  30 users using 5 VMs (150 total VMs) and with 50 users launching 10 Vms each (500 VMs total) and did not see any MD or network failures during either test. 
(The only failure I saw on the edge scale system is 1 VM which did not transition to running. All VMs were reachable via SSH using their account unique keys.)

Thanks!
-M

(Correction: remove vpc- and subnet- prefixes when searching for the veth interfaces and they are in fact created during failure. It looks like all artifacts are at least present. Now sorting through a packet capture for http/meta-data requests during this test. 

I've added more debug to the test to grab the artifacts on the CLC for the vpc, subnet, instance, etc. during a failure. In this case it looks like the veth pairs for the vpc, subnet are  setup within cloud-init's Meta-data timeout period. 
Below is a snippet of the test's output from a test:

(reopening for 4.2 release visibility)
The test results have improved a lot. Now getting a little less than double the results earlier around 17-20 accounts w/ 2-5 Vms. 
I'm still seeing Metadata issues with some of the larger tests, the error(s) look new/different. 
The test below is from a run with 22 accounts w/ VMs each. 5 accounts had 1-2 failed VMs each. The cloud-init error is:
{code}

 id' failed [25259/120s]: unexpected error [[Errno 104] Connection reset by peer]  
{code}

I haven't looked into how cloud init handles this error, (does it retry or bail?) but the CI logs say it's timed-out and giving up.

[~mclark]

All of the right bits are in place, and the network paths in question are not re-built upon network updates (meaning that there shouldn't be interruptions of this type causing connection timeouts/etc).  The one thing I'm thinking might be happenin is that, when a new VPC is connected to the metabr, the bridge delays which in before re-entering forwarding state.

If possible, can you try setting the hello and fd of the metabr to 2 seconds each, and try to trigger the effect?

brctl setfd metabr 2
brctl sethello metabr 2

This may mitigate and, if so, can be easily added to the code when metabr is created.

-d

Hi  [~dannurmi], 
I've done a few larger runs with these settings did not show the issue above. Running with 40+ unique users X (1VPC, 2 SUBNETS, 2VMS) and not seeing this issue. The test is now beginning to exceed the limits of the test machine/VM, and the capacity of this test cloud. :-). 
Thanks!
-M

as per discussion with [~dcalzago], committed bridge fd/hello set on metabr bridge creation, which matches the way that the rest of euca has been creating bridges in other modes.
